sections: subscribers will talk with environmentalist lawyer Steven Donziger and climate journalist Kate Aronoff about the current state of the climate action movement.
Donziger helped win a $9.5 billion case against Chevron for polluting the Amazon rainforest in Ecuador. As
own Walker Bragman and David Sirota

, because of a contempt charge in a countersuit filed by Chevron, Donziger has been under house arrest for nearly two years in a case that critics say has unfairly weaponized the justice system against a fossil fuel industry critic. Donziger’s trial on the matter is scheduled to begin on May 10.
Aronoff is a staff writer at
and author of the new book
Overheated: How Capitalism Broke the Planet — And How We Fight Back
, which details the forces that have hijacked progress on climate change and what it will take, politically and economically, to address the existential threat of global warming.
